alert.note: Alert for Antelope; Boone; Cedar; Cuming; Knox; Madison; Pierce; Stanton; Thurston; Wayne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 15 at 3:04PM CDT until March 17 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM THURSDAY TO 1 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 7 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of west central Iowa and east central and northeast Nebraska. * WHEN...From 4 AM Thursday through 1 AM Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Blizzard conditions will be possible for an hour or two. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines, especially if there is a glaze of ice.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet, and ice are expected or occurring. Strong winds are are expected and will contribute to reduced visibility leading to hazardous or impossible travel conditions.

area.areaDesc: Antelope; Boone; Cedar; Cuming; Knox; Madison; Pierce; Stanton; Thurston; Wayne
